pullRequest.title: Add Offline Area Viewer UI
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR adds a UI for viewing downloaded offline areas. When a user selects an area from the list of downloaded offline areas, they're presented with a viewer that:

 displays the bounds of the area in a map view
 displays the storage space the area consumes on the device (in MB)
 gives users the option to remove the area

The removal functionality isn't implemented yet--this PR just introduces the new UI and hooks it up to the Areas list.

commit.message:
Add OfflineAreaViewer UI

This change adds an offlinearea viewer--when users select an offline area from their list of areas, the viewer will present the bounds of the area, report the amount of space in MB the area occupies on the user's device and gives the user an option to remove the area from her device.

Navigate to the OfflineAreaViewer on Area item click

This commit updates the navigator and OfflineAreasFragment to navigate users to a viewer fragment for a selected offline area.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into offline-area-viewer

Fix offline area storage calculation

We need to append tile paths with the context's file dir (where they are stored) otherwise the length call returns 0.
Fix area storage size calc; truncate down to a single decimal place

nodes.bodyText: Please add class and public method Javadoc where not 100% obvious throughout.
Can we use Dagger to instantiate this instead? Injecting Provider<OfflineAreaViewerFragment> into the class where it's needed should work, maybe...
Could you possible break this stream up either into local vars or helper methods? The nesting is getting a little unwieldy.
Please use a string resource instead.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into offline-area-viewer
Add a helper method for calculating area total storage size

Use a weak reference to avoid leaking Context

The OfflineAreaViewerViewModel relies on a context to get the
application's filesdir--however, since a context is associated with a
view, using it directly can result in a memory leak. A weak reference
prevents this.
Use a string resource for the OfflineAreaViewerFragment label
Add javadoc for OfflineAreaViewer classes and methods

nodes.bodyText: Can you please add a test for this method in LocalDataStoreTest?
Would it be possible to handle the click event in the calling fragment? It feels odd to have navigator instance within this adapter class. Thoughts?
Since butterknife is already deprecated, we should prevent adding more code that needs to be cleaned up later. Can you please fix this?
We can move this method into our utility class FileUtil, which already contains context as an injected dependency.
Any specific reasons for hardcoding the width of the fragment? I would rather use constraints which only relies on screen ratio.
